item.title: About - Reza Safari
item.description: Reza has experience using data driven methodologies to drive insight for product decisions through consulting methodologies. With a background in Electrical Engineering he aims to use design thinking and lean startup methodologies to deliver further value to businesses. Reza has a skill in contributing to strategy, operation and product decisions across business units. This involves optimising processes with a constant drive for results, and looking to be able to solve greater challenges.

item.title: Interesting Reads - August
item.description: A rundown of interesting / neat / thought provoking encountered during the week. Reading Wired’s Expose on the Marcus Hutchins and WannaCry Highly recommended read. Specially the bitter-sweet ending, depending on how you look at it. Interesting Things Using Pareto Efficiency to rank Mario Kart Characters A simple method (compared to training a deep net for months to learn to play Mario Kart), presented in an actionable format.

item.title: T-Shaped Data Professional or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Specialist
item.description: Data Science is a young, growing field. It’s a field where if you’re new, you’re not sure whether to be a specialist or a generalist and if you’re already in the field, new tech comes along so often making it hard to figure out what skills you need to maximize your chances long-term? It’s a field where you can find job descriptions of a dizzying variety, so let’s look at 2 here (pseudo-randomly selected from postings in NYC) to set the scene:
